number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												I most definetly suggest this game for anyone that is into CCGs.  You may read alot of reviews nagging about the P2W, but what card game isn't.  If you are into MTG, Pokemon, Yugi, or any other CCG then I am sure that you have dropped more money then you would like to think about. Think about it for a momment.  A booster of MTG will cost you $3-$5 depending on the set which will get you 15 cards. Same goes for any CCG. Then there are the single cards that can go for way more than what a booster or even a box will cost you.  If you are a serious CCG player then you know what I am talking about. I didn't start paying for things until I had played for a few months.  I figured that the game had provided me with plenty of entertainment that sending a few bucks here and there wasn't a bad idea.  As for this grind people speak about it really isn't that bad.  During your dailies you can get up to 3 free boosters and enough silver to buy 2 more and boosters are worth 5000 silver which will get you 6 cards.  I have also recieved legendary chests as a daily reward as well.  I have collected a majority of my legendaries this way. Yes, I have bought a few of the precon decks, but thats like buying a precon deck with any CCG.   So I do not see the big gripe with the P2W asspect when it is the same for all CCGs.  The other complaint I see a lot is that you need legendaries to win and I call BS on this.  I played for the longest time without legendaries and I would still win online matches against people with stacks of legendaries.  Do legendaries help? Yes, they can. So can mythic rares and rares in MTG but they don't always make the deck. Its all about synergy and knowing how to make a proper deck.  When I played MTG those were my favorite decks to win with.  Playing against people that have dropped hundreds of dollars on their deck where mine would be but a fraction of what they spent.  One of my MTG decks that has yet to lose consists of nothing but commons and uncommons.  I took this tactic over to Solforge and it still works time to time. Like in any game you are going to win some and lose a lot.  You have to keep analysing whats out there and try to think of something that no one else has and surprise people.  If you are into CCG then I say give it a try cause as a person with 18 years of CCG playing I say it is worth it.EDIT:This is gonna be long winded, but there will be a short response below.The comment above was from some time ago and the game has changed a lot since then. I wish the game was still the one my review was originaly for, but it is not. They got rid of the ability to do your dailies against AI and that is the biggest negative thing to me. As you can see I have spent a lot of time (and some money) into this game. I would log in, do my dailies, have some fun with newer cards and then log out. This would take but just a few minutes. Now if I want to get my rewards I have to play online against people that take their sweet♥♥♥♥♥time while I start getting bored and just rage quit you could say. This game was a fun casual CCG and now they are trying to make it very uncasual. Since they have done this the community has dwindled and the game has suffered. Everyone voices what they want, and its all pretty much bring back the way the game was, and they do not listen. That is the other thing; communication with these guys is as slow as a pregnet slug on salt. When they finaly say what changes they have done, no one cares cause it is still in the wrong direction. The forums on their website are nothing but negative responses to what they have done and they dont even reply. All they ever post about are the new cards coming out and once in a full blue moon some sort of update news. I use to look forward to playing this game every day, but now I hardly ever. Truly sad.Pros-Lots of cards to play with-Fun new way to play a CCG with the leveling up of cardsCons-Game is dying-No communication from devs other than to promote new cards-Not new player friendly what so ever. I made an alt account to see if I could do anything and that was a big no go. So unless you have been playing for a while or plan to drop some serious cash, enjoy getting pounded by experienced players and their built decks. Good luck!-No dailies against AI. This was the main way to collect silver, cards, and tournament tokens, but that is gone.-They screwed up the way you could build your decks by limiting the card filters. Before you could easily sort your cards and now its a hassle.-New UI was not needed, I prefer the old beta version (as do many others)Before their "Full Launch" this game was a 10/10 for me. Now its probably a 1/10 sadly. I'll keep logging in everynow and then to see if things have been fixed, but I doubt it will ever be the way it was.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												I've been playing it for awhile now (50+ hrs into the game) and now have a good grasp of the gameplay. Solforge appears to take some ideas from deckbuilding games (such as Ascension) and adds unique concepts to the mix. The game has a refreshing Evolve mechanic where cards level up as they are played. This opens up a lot of unique cards that can be used to cull undesired cards from the deck, level up/evolve, overload (play once), etc. Thus there is a lot of nice strategies that are unique to this gamePros:- Interesting game design. Takes ideas from deckbuilders (such as Ascension, an *excellent* game these devs publish- well at least the mobile version) and mixes with Card games where you build a deck. Unfortunately, after investing more time into the game I have realize the game design has several flaws that I'll get into in the Cons section- Can trade cards that you purchased with gold (actually you share a copy of a legendary you acquired with gold)- Ranked Matches can be a lot of fun if you get a solid deck together- Can keep cards you get from drafts- Can buy starter decks that contain legendaries. You can share a 'copy' of this legendary too with a friend or community member.- Nice little community that shares the current 'meta' and info how to build a deck.- Sometimes they run Forgemaster weekends that allow users to create decks that uses *ANY* card. This gives users the opportunity to play the game with Legendaries they do not own.- Lots of science fiction themed cards which is very refreshing. Factions are Alloyin (SciFi), Nek (Zombies), and Uterra (Forest / Tree Folk)Cons:- UI is a little buggy (sometimes if you're awarded a new card from a draft for example, it may not show up until you reboot or wait 5-10 minutes)- some beginning users may find it really difficult to win early on- Community feels small as you might bump into same guy again at off-hours (sometimes a Bronze player might be pitted against a Gold or above)- Might take a lot of patience for beginners to build their collection. This might be very frustrating for a f2p gamer especially that doesn't care for Drafting.- Cards could use more flashy vfx and unique audio.- Card balance generally favors Legendary and Heroic cards. So many common cards do not see play on the constructed ladder. In order to enjoy common cards you'll want to do drafts or participate in the user run solforgeladder tournaments. But I've seen some few common cards be effective on ladder at my elo/rank. - The single player campaign is meant as a tutorial apparently and grants come cool legendary cards (very cool). I actually wish they provided more regular single player content (like some sort of optional daily or something)- Unlike most CCGs (like Hearthstone), if the match were to go long enough you'll 100% see all the cards in your deck. Not so with Solforge. Since your hand is refreshed every turn there is a chance you might not see the card you want. There is a LOT of RNG here in regards to how you receive your cards. Also, you can even level up a card and might not see it later. It can be very frustratingMixed:- You can run 3 copies of a legendary so many top tier decks are filled to the brim with high rarity cards. Plus due to lack of mana, these cards can be played asap. This might be bad for beginners that lack these cards but can be very fun for experienced players. So I'm listing this as a pro & con
